intro: Chaerophyllum balcanicum, commonly known as Balkan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. It is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer. Its botanical features make it an important species for pollinators and a component of local flora in its native habitat.
